item.title: Hacker News Top Stories: Monday, April 21, 2025 at 9:15 PM UTC
item.description:
1. Blog hosted on a Nintendo Wii (240 points | 38 comments)
2. Show HN: Dia, an open-weights TTS model for generating realistic dialogue (234 points | 62 comments)
3. Astronomers confirm the existence of a lone black hole (49 points | 48 comments)
4. Launch HN: Magic Patterns (YC W23) – AI Design and Prototyping for Product Teams (90 points | 52 comments)
5. The Value of Differences: Jennifer Lindsay on Noticing Translation (11 points | discuss)
6. Cekura (Formerly Vocera) (YC F24) Is Hiring ( | hide)
7. Pipelining might be my favorite programming language feature (203 points | 168 comments)
8. Show HN: Open Codex – OpenAI Codex CLI with open-source LLMs (21 points | 13 comments)
9. FTC takes action against Uber for deceptive billing and cancellation practices (200 points | 86 comments)
10. Optimizing Heap Allocations in Go: A Case Study (24 points | 2 comments)
11. Adding keyword parameters to Tcl procs (36 points | 11 comments)
12. Local LLM inference – impressive but too hard to work with (33 points | 29 comments)
13. Is 1 Prime, and Does It Matter? (36 points | 42 comments)
14. Dumb statistical models, always making people look bad (49 points | 5 comments)
15. An update to our pricing (59 points | 43 comments)
16. How I use Kate editor (92 points | 20 comments)

20. Getting forked by Microsoft (1460 points | 764 comments)

22. Propositional Parlor Puzzle (15 points | 1 comment)
23. Lichens can survive almost anything, and some might survive Mars (6 points | 1 comment)
24. AI assisted search-based research works now (84 points | 46 comments)
25. Tabular Programming: A New Paradigm for Expressive Computing (61 points | 14 comments)
26. Reworking 30 lines of Linux code could cut power use by up to 30 percent (224 points | 79 comments)
27. Fossil fuels fall below 50% of US electricity for the first month on record (215 points | 219 comments)
28. Show HN: Light like the Terminal – Meet GTK LLM Chat Front End (24 points | 10 comments)
29. Reverse engineering the obfuscated TikTok VM (366 points | 104 comments)
30. Haskelling My Python (130 points | 51 comments)
